text: Tell him what a dreadful state I am in, that I am strongly inclined to hope the best, and that his feelings were not of a kind to make her think him less agreeable.

passages.fragment: Tell him what a dreadful state I am in , that I am
passages.full_quote: <used>Tell him what a dreadful state I am in, that I am</used> frighted out of my wits -- and have such tremblings, such flutterings, all over me -- such spasms in my side and pains in my head, and such beatings at heart, that I can get no rest by night nor by day

passages.fragment: , that I am strongly inclined to hope the best
passages.full_quote: It appears to me so very unlikely that any young man should form such a design against a girl who is by no means unprotected or friendless, and who was actually staying in his colonel's family<used>, that I am strongly inclined to hope the best</used>

passages.fragment: to hope the best , and that his
passages.full_quote: But I am willing <used>to hope the best, and that his</used> character has been misunderstood

passages.fragment: , and that his feelings were not of a
passages.full_quote: To Elizabeth it appeared that, had her family made an agreement to expose themselves as much as they could during the evening, it would have been impossible for them to play their parts with more spirit or finer success; and happy did she think it for Bingley and her sister that some of the exhibition had escaped his notice<used>, and that his feelings were not of a</used> sort to be much distressed by the folly which he must have witnessed

passages.fragment: were not of a kind to make her think him less agreeable
passages.full_quote: Her fellow-travellers the next day <used>were not of a kind to make her think him less agreeable</used>
